Class AbstractWorld<E>

java.lang.Object
  AbstractWorld<E>
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, World<E>
Direct Known Subclasses:
LimitedWorld
public class AbstractWorld<E>
extends java.lang.Object
implements World<E>

The AbstractWorld class.

This is the code implementation for the World interface, and contains all basic code functionality for the methods specified in the World interface.

Since:
May 9, 2011
Version:
1.0.0.2 : May 15, 2011
Author:
Mihail Kurbako
See Also:
World, GameObject, AbstractGameObject, Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

AbstractWorld

public AbstractWorld(int w,
                     int h,
                     double solidity,
                     double goalX,
                     double goalY,
                     double goalR,
                     int s)
Creates an instance of the World Object with given parameters (namely width and height). These parameter values are set in the constructor along with the instantiation of the private field world, which is an ArrayList\ Object in which data for all GameObjects in this world is stored.

Parameters:
w - The initial width value for the World
h - The initial height value for the World
See Also:
World

getAtCoords

public java.lang.Object getAtCoords(int x,
                                    int y)
Returns the Object at the specified coordinates within this World. If no Object falls within those coordinates, it returns null.

Parameters:
x - The X value the Object's bounds exist within.
y - The Y value the Object's bounds exist within.
Returns:
The first instance of a GameObject within the area of (X, Y), null otherwise.

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
Checks if a given Object and this Object are the same. Automatically returns false if the given Object is not an instance of World. If the given Object is a World it compares the Objects' hash codes. Override from java.lang.Object.

getPlayer

public Player getPlayer()
Description copied from interface: World

getBaseScore

public int getBaseScore()
Description copied from interface: World
The starting value for the Player's score in this instance of the World Object. It is then compared to time and number of bounces to produce a final score for the level.

Specified by:
getBaseScore in interface World<E>
Returns:
The starting value for score.
